gaslighting.name: Gaslighting Detector

Reality Denial.response: I know what happened. I was there.

Memory Attack.description: Attacking your memory to create doubt
Memory Attack.response: My memory is fine. I remember this clearly.

Perception Invalidation.response: My perception is valid. I experienced what I experienced.

Emotion Dismissal.description: Telling you how to feel about your experience
Emotion Dismissal.response: I decide how I feel about things that happen to me.

Rewriting History.description: Changing the narrative after the fact
Rewriting History.response: I understood exactly what you said.

Blame Reversal.description: Making you responsible for their actions
Blame Reversal.response: You are responsible for your own actions.

Isolation Attempt.description: Making you feel alone in your perception
Isolation Attempt.response: Others' opinions don't change my experience.

Sanity Questioning.response: I'm perfectly capable of assessing my own mental state.

reality_checks: Your experience is real - you lived it
Confusion after conversations is a red flag
Document incidents in writing
Repeated gaslighting is emotional abuse
Trust your gut - if something feels wrong, it is
Talk to someone you trust about these incidents

love_bombing.name: Love Bombing Detector
love_bombing.description: Detect excessive early affection used for manipulation

Intensity Spike.response: Real connection develops gradually, not instantly.

Future Faking.response: Let's focus on getting to know each other first.

Constant Contact.response: I need space to maintain my own life.

Gift Bombardment.response: I appreciate thoughtfulness, not overwhelming gestures.

reality_checks: Healthy relationships develop slowly over time
Love bombing is about control, not affection
Notice if intensity drops after you commit
Real love allows you to maintain independence

guilt_trip.name: Guilt Trip Detector

After Everything I've Done.description: Using past favors to create obligation
After Everything I've Done.response: I appreciate what you've done, but that doesn't obligate me to this specific thing

Comparison Shame.description: Comparing you unfavorably to create shame
Comparison Shame.response: I make decisions based on what's right for me, not comparisons

Disappointment Play.response: Your disappointment is about your expectations, not my choices

Hurt Display.response: I'm sorry you're hurt, but I'm not responsible for your feelings about my boundaries

Suffering Emphasis.response: I care about your wellbeing, but I can't always be the solution

Abandonment Frame.response: Setting boundaries isn't abandonment - it's healthy

Martyrdom.description: Playing the martyr to induce guilt
Martyrdom.response: I hear you'll manage - I trust you

Silent Treatment Preview.response: That's your choice. I'm still here if you want to talk respectfully

severity_levels.label: NO GUILT TRIPS DETECTED
severity_levels.desc: No obvious guilt manipulation patterns found

reality_checks: You are not responsible for others' feelings about your boundaries
Past favors don't create unlimited future obligations
Healthy relationships respect 'no'
Guilt is a signal to check if YOU did something wrong, not automatic compliance

future_faking.name: Future Faking Detector
future_faking.description: Detect false promises about the future

Grand Future Plans.description: Creating elaborate future scenarios too early
Grand Future Plans.response: Let's focus on the present and build trust gradually

Timeline Pushing.response: These are important decisions that need time and real foundation

Perfect Life Painting.response: Real relationships have challenges - this sounds too idealized

Conditional Promises.description: Making promises contingent on your compliance
Conditional Promises.response: I need to see consistent actions now, not conditional future promises

severity_levels.label: REALISTIC DISCUSSION
severity_levels.desc: Future talk seems grounded and gradual

severity_levels.label: FUTURE FAKING SIGNS
severity_levels.desc: pattern(s) - may be moving too fast

reality_checks: Actions in the present matter more than promises about the future
Healthy relationships build gradually, not through grand future visions
If they're perfect in fantasy but problematic now, believe the now
Future faking is a control tactic to keep you invested

hoovering.name: Hoovering Detector
hoovering.description: Detect attempts to suck you back into toxic relationship

Sudden Reappearance.description: Reappearing out of nowhere with emotional hooks
Sudden Reappearance.response: Actions over time matter more than sudden emotional appeals

Crisis Hook.description: Creating crisis to pull you back in
Crisis Hook.response: If it's a real crisis, there are other resources available

Changed Person Claim.response: Real change takes time and shows in consistent actions, not words

Good Times Nostalgia.description: Romanticizing past to erase bad memories
Good Times Nostalgia.response: Selective memory - the bad times were real too

Breadcrumbs.response: These aren't real connection attempts, they're hooks

severity_levels.label: STRONG HOOVERING
severity_levels.desc: patterns - manipulation to pull you back

reality_checks: People rarely change without significant time and effort
If they were toxic before, a few weeks won't fix that
Hoovering intensifies when they lose control
Maintain your boundaries - you left for good reasons

emotional_blackmail.name: Emotional Blackmail Detector
emotional_blackmail.description: Identify FOG: Fear, Obligation, Guilt manipulation

Threats.description: Direct or implied threats of negative consequences
Threats.response: Threats are not acceptable - this is emotional abuse

Self-Harm Threats.description: Threatening self-harm to control you - call 988 if serious
Self-Harm Threats.response: If serious, call 988. Their mental health is not your responsibility to manage alone

Duty Appeals.description: Appealing to obligation to override your choice
Duty Appeals.response: I decide my own obligations based on what's right for me

Shame Induction.description: Making you feel defective for having boundaries
Shame Induction.response: Having boundaries doesn't make me a bad person

Historical Debt.description: Citing past actions to create current debt
Historical Debt.response: Past kindness doesn't create unlimited future obligations

Victim Playing.description: Positioning themselves as victim of your boundaries
Victim Playing.response: I can see you're upset, but my boundary stands

Silent Treatment.response: I'm here when you want to communicate respectfully

Love Withdrawal.response: Real love doesn't require me to violate my boundaries

severity_levels.label: EMOTIONAL BLACKMAIL
severity_levels.desc: Multiple tactics to control through FOG

reality_checks: Your 'no' is a complete sentence
You can care about someone AND have boundaries
Their emotions are not your emergency
This is abuse - consider professional support if severe

triangulation.name: Triangulation Detector
triangulation.description: Identify when a third party is used to manipulate

Comparison to Ex.description: Using past relationships to create competition/insecurity
Comparison to Ex.response: I'm not interested in comparisons - let's discuss us

Third Party Agreement.description: Claiming others agree to strengthen their position
Third Party Agreement.response: I'd like to hear their opinion directly

Secret Information.response: I'll talk to them directly if there's an issue

Jealousy Induction.description: Mentioning others' interest to provoke jealousy
Jealousy Induction.response: I trust you - this information doesn't change that

Flying Monkeys.description: Recruiting others to their cause against you
Flying Monkeys.response: I'll get the full story directly from the source

Comparison Shame.description: Using others to make you feel inadequate
Comparison Shame.response: I don't need to prove myself against anyone

Messenger Manipulation.description: Using you as messenger to another person
Messenger Manipulation.response: You can communicate with them directly

severity_levels.label: TRIANGULATION DETECTED
severity_levels.desc: Multiple tactics to involve third parties

reality_checks: Healthy communication is direct, not through third parties
If they wanted to resolve it, they'd talk to YOU
You don't need to prove yourself against anyone
Triangulation creates chaos - that's the goal

projection.name: Projection Detector
projection.description: Identify when someone accuses you of their behavior

Accusation of Their Behavior.description: Accusing you of exactly what they do
Accusation of Their Behavior.response: Let's look at the facts - who actually does this?

Sudden Character Attack.description: Labels that come from nowhere and describe them
Sudden Character Attack.response: Where is this coming from? This doesn't match my actions

Preemptive Defense.description: Defending against accusations you didn't make
Preemptive Defense.response: I didn't accuse you of that - why bring it up?

DARVO Pattern.description: Deny, Attack, Reverse Victim and Offender
DARVO Pattern.response: Let's stay on the original topic - what actually happened

Excessive Suspicion.description: Extreme suspicion often reveals their own behavior
Excessive Suspicion.response: This level of suspicion says more about you than me

Jealousy Accusation.description: Accusing you of jealousy they actually feel
Jealousy Accusation.response: I'm not jealous - I'm responding to your behavior

reality_checks: You don't have to defend against false accusations
Redirect: 'Let's stay on the original topic'
Their perception of you says more about them
Projection is a defense mechanism - they can't face their own behavior
Document incidents - patterns become clear over time
